answerText: Tajima's D[10] An example of non-neutral evolution is this disorder, characterized by red blood cells taking on an abnormal shape. Carriers of this disease are notably resistant to malaria.
heading: ACF Winter |2009 | Brown University and Notre Dame | 17 | Science | Biology | College
subject: Science
question: Question: This statistic is calculated by finding the difference between two measures of the variable theta and then dividing by the standard deviation of the measurement. FTPE: [10] Name this statistical test named for a Japanese mathematician that is used to distinguish between neutral evolution or selection.
